intro: Mekistus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosettes of dark green, leathery leaves and tall, slender flowering stalks. The flowers are typically white or pale green, with six petals and prominent stamens. Mekistus species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. These plants are often found in woodland areas and are known for their toxic properties, containing cardiac glycosides that can be harmful to humans and animals.
